isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - DISASSEMBLY - UPPER KING PIN, STEERING ARM AND KING PIN BUSHING REMOVAL

svcproc.title: UPPER KING PIN, STEERING ARM AND KING PIN BUSHING REMOVAL

step1.para: The upper kingpin may be removed after the spindle yoke is removed or after the complete outboard section has been removed.
Remove the locknut from the kingpin stud. Use a jack or jackscrew to pry between the lower portion of the suspension yoke and the stud to force the stud from its tapered hole.

Remove drag link from steering arm by applying a force between the drag link end and the steering arm and then striking the steering arm radially to tapered ball connection. Avoid driving on the end of tapered ball, stud and nut, as this will generally severely damage the end of the tapered ball before the parts separate.
Remove the four locknuts from the steering arm studs and remove the arm.

Remove upper kingpin bearing only if replacing with a new part. After removing the upper kingpin bracket from the steerable drive end assembly, melt the bearing by applying heat from a propane type torch directly to the bearing.
